trans-unit.source: Specifies a physical font face that corresponds to a font file on the disk.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> object is a low level text object that corresponds to a single face of a font family as represented by an OpenType font file, or serialized as a block of memory in a document.

The correct <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> to use for a run of characters in a given logical font is normally determined by the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] font system and recorded in the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> objects generated by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText> object and line formatting text [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)].
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> provides properties and methods for:
Obtaining font face common metrics, such as the ratio of ascent and descent to em size.
Obtaining metrics, outlines, and bitmaps for individual glyphs.
Serialization in a document.
The following list describes the type of application scenarios that illustrate the value of using the low-level control that the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> object provides.
A fixed format document generator may use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> to obtain a binary image of the font for embedding in a document container
A printer driver may use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> to obtain font glyph outlines or bitmaps, or the entire font image for sending to the printer.
A <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> viewer application may use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> to obtain metric and bitmap information.
Each glyph defines metrics that specify how it aligns with other <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Glyphs>.
The following graphic defines metric values for glyph characters.
![Diagraph of glyph measurements](~/add/media/glyph-example.png "Diagraph of glyph measurements")
Metric values of glyph characters
XAML Text Usage
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> class using the specified font file location.
This constructor creates a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> object from an OpenType font face specified by `typefaceSource`.
The constructed <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> object does not use style simulations.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] that specifies the location of the font file.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> class using the specified font file location and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StyleSimulations"></xref> value.
This constructor creates a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> object from an OpenType font face specified by `typefaceSource` and `styleSimulations`.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] that specifies the location of the font file.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StyleSimulations"></xref> values.
Gets the advance heights for the glyphs represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.AdvanceHeights%2A> property is used for calculating vertical layout.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key-value pairs that represents advance height information for the glyphs.
The key is a <xref href="System.UInt16"></xref> that identifies the glyph index.
The value is a <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the advance height.
Gets the advance widths for the glyphs represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.AdvanceHeights%2A> property is used for calculating horizontal layout.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs that represents advance width information for the glyphs.
The key is a <xref href="System.UInt16"></xref> that identifies the glyph index.
The value is a <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the advance width.
Gets the baseline value for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref>.
The baseline value represents the distance from cell top to English baseline relative to em size.
A value of type <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the baseline.
Gets the distance from bottom edge of the black box to the bottom end of the advance vector for the glyphs represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.BottomSideBearings%2A> value is positive when the bottom edge of the black box is within the alignment rectangle defined by the advance width and font cell height.
The font cell height is a horizontal dimension in vertical layout.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.BottomSideBearings%2A> value is negative when the bottom edge of the black box overhangs the alignment rectangle.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs that represent distance information.
The key is a <xref href="System.UInt16"></xref> that identifies the glyph.
The value is a <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the distance.
Gets the distance from the baseline to the top of an English capital, relative to em size, for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that indicates the distance from the baseline to the top of an English capital letter, expressed as a fraction of the font em size.
Gets the nominal mapping of a Unicode code point to a glyph index as defined by the font 'CMAP' table.

An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains the mapping of a Unicode code points to glyph indices for all glyphs in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
Returns the binary image of the font subset based on a specified collection of glyphs.
The collection of glyph indices to be included in the subset.
A <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> array that represents the binary image of the font subset.
Gets the copyright information for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.Copyrights%2A> property is separate from the trademark information that is access by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.Trademarks%2A> property.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs that represent copyright information.
The key is a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that identifies the culture.
The value is a copyright information string.
Gets the description information for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
The description information for a <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> object can include revision notes, usage recommendations, history, features, as well as other information.

An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs The key is a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that identifies the culture.
The value is a description information string.
Gets the designer information for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs that represent designer information.
The key is a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that identifies the culture.
The value is a designer information string.
Gets the designer URL information for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs that represent designer information.
The key is a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that identifies the culture.
The value is a string that references a designer URL.
Gets the offset value from the horizontal Western baseline to the bottom of the glyph black box for the glyphs represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs that represent offsets for the glyphs.
The key is a <xref href="System.UInt16"></xref> that identifies the glyph index.
The value is a <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the offset value.
Gets the font embedding permission for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontEmbeddingRight"></xref> values that represents the font embedding permission
Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
Two <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> objects are considered equal if the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.StyleSimulations%2A> properties are equal.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to compare with the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
`true` if o is a and is equal to the current ; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the face name for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
If the font file does not provide a name for the specified language, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.FaceNames%2A> property returns the face name in English.
The face name may identify weight, style, and/or stretch information.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs that represent face name information.
The key is a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that identifies the culture.
The value is a string containing the face name.
Gets the family name for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
If the font file does not provide a family name for the specified language, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.FamilyNames%2A> property returns the family name in English.
The family name excludes weight, style, and stretch information.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs that represent family name information.
The key is a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that identifies the culture.
The value is a string containing the family name.
Gets or sets the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
XAML Text Usage
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
Returns the font file stream represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> value that represents the font file.
Returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> value describing the path for a single glyph in the font.
The path represents the glyph without grid fitting applied for rendering at a specific resolution.
The index of the glyph to get the outline for.
The font size in drawing surface units.
The size to hint for in points.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> value that represents the path of the glyph.
Serves as a hash function for <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref>.
A hash code for the current object.
Gets the number of glyphs for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
The total number of glyphs.
Gets the height of the character cell relative to the em size.
An <xref href="System.Double"></xref> value that represents the height of the character cell.
Gets the distance from the leading end of the advance vector to the left edge of the black box for the glyphs represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.LeftSideBearings%2A> value is positive when the left edge of the black box is within the alignment rectangle defined by the advance width and font cell height.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.LeftSideBearings%2A> value is negative when the left edge of the black box overhangs the alignment rectangle.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs that represent distance information for the glyphs.
The key is a <xref href="System.UInt16"></xref> that identifies the glyph index.
The value is a <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the distance.
Gets the font license description information for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs font license information.
The key is a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that identifies the culture.
The value is a string that describes the font license information.
Gets the font manufacturer information for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs for the font manufacturer information.
The key is a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that identifies the culture.
The value is a string that describes the font manufacturer information.
Gets the distance from the right edge of the black box to the right end of the advance vector for the glyphs represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.RightSideBearings%2A> value is positive when the trailing edge of the black box is within the alignment rectangle defined by the advance width and font cell height.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.RightSideBearings%2A> value is negative when the right edge of the black box overhangs the alignment rectangle.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs that represent distance information.
The key is a <xref href="System.UInt16"></xref> that identifies the glyph index.
The value is a <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the distance.
Gets the sample text information for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.SampleTexts%2A> value can be the font name, or any other text that the designer thinks is the best sample to display the font in.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs sample text information.
The key is a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that identifies the culture.
The value is a string that describes the sample text information.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.FontStretch"></xref> value for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Windows.FontStretch"></xref> value that represents the font stretch.
Gets a value that indicates the distance from the baseline to the strikethrough for the typeface.
The strikethrough position value is usually positive because the strikethrough is generally above the baseline.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the strikethrough position.
Gets a value that indicates the thickness of the strikethrough relative to the font em size.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that indicates the strikethrough thickness, expressed as a fraction of the font em size.
Gets the style for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> value that represents the style value.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StyleSimulations"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
XAML Text Usage
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.StyleSimulations"></xref> values that represents the style simulation for the font.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> font conforms to Unicode encoding.
The font may be considered as a simple collection of symbols indexed by a code point.
`true` if the font conforms to Unicode encoding; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the distance from the top end of the vertical advance vector to the top edge of the black box for the glyphs represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.TopSideBearings%2A> value is positive when the top edge of the black box is within the alignment rectangle defined by the advance height and font cell height.
The font cell height is a horizontal dimension in vertical layout.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.TopSideBearings%2A> value is negative when the top edge of the black box overhangs the alignment rectangle.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs that represent distance information.
The key is a <xref href="System.UInt16"></xref> that identifies the glyph index.
The value is a <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the distance.
Gets the trademark notice information for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.Trademarks%2A> property is separate from the copyright information that is access by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.Copyrights%2A> property.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs that represent trademark notice information.
The key is a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that identifies the culture.
The value is a string that the trademark notice information.
Gets the position of the underline in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref>.
The underline position is relative to the baseline and relative to the em size.
The returned position value is usually negative because an underline is usually below the baseline.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> value that represents the position of the underline.
Gets the thickness of the underline relative to em size.
A value of type <xref href="System.Double"></xref>.
Gets the vendor URL information for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
A font vendor could embed a unique serial number in the URL, which could then be used to register the font.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs that represent vendor URL information.
The key is a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that identifies the culture.
The value is a string that references a vendor URL.
Gets the font face version interpreted from the font's 'NAME' table.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> value that represents the version.
Gets the version string information for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object interpreted from the font's 'NAME' table.
Version strings vary significantly in format.

To obtain the version as a numeric value, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.Version%2A>—do not attempt to parse the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.VersionStrings%2A> property.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs that represent version string information.
The key is a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that identifies the culture.
The value is a string that represents the version.
Gets the designed weight of the font represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
A value of type <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> that represents the font weight.
Gets the Win32 face name for the font represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
If the font does not provide a name for the specified language, it returns the face name in English.
The Win32 face name may identify weights (other than regular or bold), and/or style, but may not identify stretch or other weights.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs that represent Win32 face name information.
The key is a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that identifies the culture.
The value is a string that represents the Win32 face name.
Gets the Win32 family name for the font represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
If the font does not provide a family name for the specified language, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.Win32FamilyNames%2A> property returns the family name in English.
The Win32 family name excludes regular or bold weights and style, but it includes other weights and stretch.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> object that contains key/value pairs that represent Win32 family name information.
The key is a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that identifies the culture.
The value is a string that represents the Win32 family name.
Gets the Western x-height relative to em size for the font represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> object.
A value of type <xref href="System.Double"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize.BeginInit"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize.EndInit"></xref>.
